content.description: Gluten Free starts at good holds in the slanting crack under the bulge. Powerful wide spans lead to an awkward left-hand edge and a poor pinch. Huck for a textured hold over the lip and move right to mantel (no gimme.) Starting at the edge and bad pinch is The Jackhammer, V9.
content.location: The undercut bulge on the left end of the first wall reached on the trail.

content.description: The block feature in the middle of the Gluten Free wall: start on pinches beneath the block and make moves to the opposing aretes. Layback the right arete (easier), or climb both aretes direct without the right wall. Either way it's a good time.
content.protection: A pad or two depending on your comfort level.
content.location: The double arete feature in the middle of the Gluten Free wall.

content.description: This area is pretty small, but its high concentration of quality routes, coupled with a short approach, make it the best place to get acquainted with Freidlein. The main attractions include a wall with several good mid-range problems and the hard classic Gluten Free, and a huge pointed boulder whose highball downhill face produces a few proud, aesthetic face problems. These and a few other scattered boulders and crags boast excellent rock and a serene setting.
